translation: Again, the Buddha thought: Now there are bhikṣus within my doctrine who do not follow the same principles of speech and conduct as I have taught them. They may engage in divergent ways of speaking and be contradictory to each other; or they may seek gain for their livelihood by means of property, money, food, and drink.

source_sentence: 或為名譽、要集眷屬，或有厭惡王法役使出家為道，都無有心向三脫門，
translation: Whether for fame or to gather their followers, or if there are those who dislike the king’s religious service and make them leave home in order to follow the path, they all have no intention of dedicating themselves to the three gates of liberation.

source_sentence: 度三有苦。
translation: He's liberated from the suffering of the three existences.

source_sentence: 以不淨心貪受信施，不知後世彌劫受殃償其宿債。
translation: With an impure mind, he clings to faithful giving and doesn't know that the next life will be a long eon of suffering and repaying his past debts.

translation: For this reason, how could it not be explained?

source_sentence: 佛告王曰：「憶念過去無數劫時，有一大國名裴扇闍，有一女人名曰提違，
translation: The Buddha said to the king, “Remember that in an immeasurable number of past aeons there was a great country called Parixiangzha. There was a woman named Tiqiao (i.e., Licchavi Vimalakīrti).

source_sentence: 婆羅門種，夫喪守寡，其家大富，都無兒息又無父母，守孤抱窮無所恃怙。
translation: The brāhmaṇas are poor and their families are very wealthy. All of them have no children or parents, and they live alone in the lonely houses without any support.

source_sentence: 婆羅門法，若不如意，便生自燒身。
translation: If he doesn't follow the Brāhmaṇa teaching, then he'll give rise to his own body that burns itself up.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門時時共往到提違所，教化之曰：『今身之厄，莫不由汝前身罪故。
translation: The brāhmaṇas often went together to the place where Tiṣya was staying and led and inspired him, saying, 'None of the troubles in my present body are caused by your past sins.

source_sentence: 何謂為罪？
translation: What's meant by sin?

source_sentence: 不敬奉事諸婆羅門，又不孝順父母、夫婿，復無慈心養育兒子；
translation: They do not honor and serve the brahmans. They are not filial to their parents, husbands, wives, sons, or daughters-in-law (i.e., laymen). Moreover, they lack kindness in raising children.

source_sentence: 有是罪故，致令今身抱孤守厄。
translation: Because of this sin, he's now left with an orphaned person in his body to guard the trouble.

source_sentence: 汝今若不修福滅罪，後世轉劇墮地獄中，當爾之時悔無所及。』
translation: If you don't cultivate goodness and extinguish sins now, you'll fall into hell in a later life and be reborn there, and at that point your repentance will be unfathomable.'

source_sentence: 「提違問曰：『當作何福，得滅罪耶？』
translation: Tiṣya asked, 'What good deed will you do to extinguish sins?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：『滅罪二種：其罪輕者，手自髠頭香湯洗浴，入天廟中，懺悔辭謝那羅延天，
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'There are two kinds of extinction of sin: the lesser sin is to wash and bathe oneself with scented warm water on the tip of your forehead.

source_sentence: 請婆羅門足一百人，施設飲食；
translation: He invited the Brahmans, who numbered one hundred in number, to prepare food and drink.

source_sentence: 設飲食已，以乳牛百頭從犢子者嚫婆羅門，然後罪滅。
translation: After he set up the food and drink, he gave a hundred heads of milk cows to the Vātsīputrīya Brahmā, and then his sins were extinguished.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門修淨梵行，不食酒肉五辛葱蒜，唯仰牛乳以為食資，令施主檀越滅罪生福，
translation: The brāhmaṇas, practicing pure and genuine austerity, did not eat alcohol, meat, spices, spices, or garlic. They relied only on cow’s milk as food to sustain their charitable benefactors and enable them to extinguish sins and produce merit.

source_sentence: 世世所生所願從心。
translation: It's the mind that follows the wishes that arise from generation to generation.

source_sentence: 汝今罪重，應以家中一切所有諸珍寶物，布施五百大婆羅門；
translation: Because of the seriousness of your sins, you should now distribute all the treasures and belongings of your house to five hundred great brahmans.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門得布施已，當為呪願，令汝後生常得大富。
translation: Having obtained this offering, the brāhmaṇas should make a magical vow that will enable you to always attain great wealth in your future existence.

source_sentence: 欲滅罪者，於恒水邊積薪自燒，諸婆羅門當復呪願，令汝前身所造一切輕重過罪一時滅盡，
translation: If you want to extinguish sins, you must store up firewood and burn it yourself at the edge of the Ganges River. The brāhmaṇas should also perform a mantra spell so that all the minor and major sins you committed in your previous life will be instantly extinguished.

source_sentence: 後世更生無復餘殃，父母兄弟夫婿兒子壽命無量、快樂無極。』
translation: In a later life, there will be no more calamities, and their parents, brothers, husbands, sons, and daughters will have an immeasurable life span and happiness without limit.'

source_sentence: 於是提違便許可之，決定開心，當自燒身。
translation: Deva then agreed to allow him to do so, determined that he would be released and burn his own body.

source_sentence: 便勅家奴將十乘車入山伐樵，規以自燒。
translation: He then ordered his householders to drive the ten-vehicle chariot into the mountains to cut down the wood for firewood and burn it themselves.

source_sentence: 「爾時國中有一道人，名鉢底婆(齊言辯才)，精進持戒、多聞智慧，
translation: At the time, there was a man in that country named Padmavyūha (known as Bimbisāra in Chinese), who diligently observed precepts and was well-versed and wise.

source_sentence: 常以慈心教化天下，令改邪就正捨惡修善。
translation: He always taught the world with a compassionate mind, causing error to be corrected, righteousness to be abandoned, badness to be cultivated, and goodness to be cultivated.

source_sentence: 傳聞提違欲自燒身，心生憐愍，往詣其所問提違言：『辦具薪火，欲何所為？』
translation: When he heard that Tiṣya wanted to burn his own body, he became compassionate and went to where he was and asked Tiṣya, 'What do you want me to do with the firewood?'

source_sentence: 提違答言：『欲自燒身滅除殃罪。』
translation: Tiṣya replied, 'I want to burn my own body and extinguish the sin of blameworthiness.'

source_sentence: 辯才答曰：『先身罪業，隨逐精神、不與身合，徒苦燒身安能滅罪？
translation: Bimbisāra answered, 'Suppose a sinful action in the prior body follows the mind and doesn't come together with the body, and it's only painful and burns the body that can be extinguished.

source_sentence: 夫人禍福隨心而起，心念善故受報亦善，心念惡故受惡果報，心念苦樂受報亦爾。
translation: Good or bad deeds of the wife arise in accordance with awarenesses. Because awarenesses are good, they experience retribution; because awarenesses are bad, they experience retribution. The same applies to awarenesses that are painful and to awarenesses that are blissful!®*?

source_sentence: 如人餓死則作餓鬼，苦惱死者受苦惱報，歡喜死者受歡喜報，安隱快樂，
translation: “Suppose someone dies of hunger and becomes a hungry ghost. Those who die with distress experience the results of suffering and distress, but those who die joyfully experience the results of joy when they are overjoyed.

source_sentence: 果報亦爾。
translation: So it is with the result.

source_sentence: 汝今云何於苦惱中，求欲滅罪、望善報也？
translation: How are you now seeking to extinguish sins and expecting good rewards in the midst of suffering?

source_sentence: 幸可不須，於理不通。
translation: It's fortunate that it's not necessary, but it doesn't apply to the principle.

source_sentence: 「『復次提違，如困病人為苦所逼，若有惡人來至其所，呵罵病人、以手摶耳。
translation: 'Furthermore, it's like a disobedient person who's tormented by suffering and is oppressed by pain. If a bad person comes to them, they scold the sick person or s pat him with their hands and ears.

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時病人，寧有善心，無忿惱不？』
translation: Would the sick man then have a good heart and not be angry?'

source_sentence: 提違答言：『其人困病，未見人時常懷忿惱，況被摶耳而當無忿。』
translation: Tiṣya replied, 'That person is sick and doesn't always harbor anger when he sees someone, so why wouldn't he harbor anger if he were to cut off his ears and have no anger?'

source_sentence: 「辯才告曰：『汝今如是，先身罪故，守窮抱厄常懷憂惱，復欲燒身欲離憂惱，
當可得不？
translation: Will it be obtained?

source_sentence: 如困病人，得人呵罵，尚增苦惱百千萬倍；
translation: It is like the case of a sick man in distress who receives criticism from others, which increases by a hundred million times.

source_sentence: 況自燒身，猛炎起時身體焦爛，氣息未絕、心未壞故，當爾之時身心被煮，
translation: How much more so when he burns his own body! At the moment of arising with ferocious heat, his body is burned to a boil. Because his breathing has not yet gone out or his heart has not broken down? At that moment, his body and mind are cooked:

source_sentence: 神識未離，故受苦毒煩悶心惱，從是命終生地獄中，地獄苦惱尤轉增劇百千萬倍，
translation: Because they have not yet separated from the consciousness of supernormal cognition, they experience pain and vexation in their minds. As a result, at the end of their life, they are reborn in hell. The pain and suffering of hell increases one hundred million times.

source_sentence: 求免甚難，況欲燒身求離苦也。
translation: It's very difficult to escape, so why wouldn't you want to burn your body and seek freedom from suffering?

source_sentence: 復次提違！
translation: Furthermore,提違!

source_sentence: 譬如車牛厭患車故欲使車壞，前車若壞續得後車扼其項領，罪未畢故。
translation: It's like a cart that an ox is disillusioned with a cart and wants to cause the cart to break down, and if the prior cart breaks down, it can continue to be caught by the latter chariot at its neck because its sin hasn't ended.

source_sentence: 人亦如是，縱令燒壞百千萬身，罪業因緣相續不滅。
translation: Even if someone were to cause a hundred million bodies to be burned and destroyed, the causes and conditions of their sins wouldn't cease for a long time.

source_sentence: 如阿鼻獄燒諸罪人，一日之中八萬過死、八萬更生，過一劫已其罪方畢。
translation: It's like the avīci hell that burns sinners 80,000 deaths and 80,000 rebirths in a single day, and after one eon, their sins are completed.

source_sentence: 況復汝今，一過燒身欲求滅罪，何有得理？』
translation: How could it be reasonable for you now to want to extinguish a sin by committing a single offense that burns your body?'

source_sentence: 「爾時辯才種種因緣為說正法，提違女人心開意解，改志易操燒身意息，
translation: At the time, he was eloquent and explained the right teaching for various reasons to women who disobeyed him. Their minds were enlightened, and they changed their intentions so as to be able to control themselves free of burning body and mind.

source_sentence: 白辯才言：『當設何意，令得滅罪？』
translation: He said to the eloquent, 'What do you think you'll do to extinguish your sins?'

source_sentence: 辯才答言：『前心作惡如雲覆月，後心起善如炬消闇。
translation: His eloquence answered, 'The former mind does evil like clouds covering the moon, and the latter mind produces goodness like a torch that extinguishes darkness.

source_sentence: 汝今幸有欲滅罪意，自有方便，我能令汝不費一錢，乃至不經毫分之苦，
translation: Now, fortunately, you have the intention to extinguish this blameworthy sin. You have your own expedient means by which I can enable you to do so without paying a penny or even a tiny bit of pain.

source_sentence: 滅除殃罪、現世安隱，後更生處善願從心。』
translation: He extinguishes blameworthy sins and becomes peaceful in the present life, and then he'll be reborn in a good place to follow his mind.'

source_sentence: 「提違聞已心大歡喜，憂怖即除，如重罪囚蒙赦欲出，即起修敬，禮拜問訊，
translation: Having heard these words, Tiṣya was greatly delighted. His grief and fear were immediately dispelled. Like a condemned prisoner who wishes to escape punishment for a serious offense, he rose up in respect and veneration, bowed his head in homage, and made obeisance.

source_sentence: 即勅婢使，為敷高座，氍毺毾[毯-炎+登]，錦繡綩綖，嚴飾第一，
translation: I ordered my maidservants to spread a high seat, draped with woolen blankets and embroidered silk; decorated most magnificently.

source_sentence: 散花燒香，勸請辯才令登高座。
translation: They scattered flowers and burned incense, exhorting eloquence to ascend the high seat.

source_sentence: 辯才受請，即昇高座。
translation: When he was invited by the eloquence, he ascended a high seat.

source_sentence: 提違女人即率家內奴婢眷屬五百餘人，圍繞辯才，叩頭恭敬，合掌而立。
translation: The woman Devānām-Indra led more than five hundred servants and retinues from her house, surrounded by eloquence, bowed their heads in respect, joined their palms, and stood.

source_sentence: 「提違女人白辯才言：『尊向所說滅罪事由，雖懷欣慶，猶有微疑。
translation: Again, contrary to the woman's explanation, he said eloquently, 'The Bhagavān explains the causes for extinguishing sins, but even though he's delighted, there's still a slight doubt.

source_sentence: 惟願為說除罪之法，當如法行。』
translation: May I explain the method of removing sins for you, and you'll practice according to the teaching.'

source_sentence: 辯才答曰：『起罪之由，出身口意，身業不善，殺、盜、邪婬；
translation: The eloquent man replied, “The reasons for the sins committed are due to verbal and mental actions, unwholesome bodily actions, taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, and immorality.

source_sentence: 口業不善，妄言、兩舌、惡口、綺語；
translation: verbal action is unwholesome: false speech, divisive speech, harsh words and fancy talk.

source_sentence: 意業不善，嫉妬、瞋恚、憍慢邪見；
translation: Mental action is unwholesome:

source_sentence: 是為十惡，受惡果報。
translation: These are the ten evil deeds that bring bad retribution.

source_sentence: 今當一心丹誠懺悔，若於過去、若於今身有如是罪，今悉懺悔，出罪滅罪。
translation: You must now wholeheartedly and sincerely repent with one mind. If you committed such sins in the past or present body, we will all repent and extinguish them.

source_sentence: 當自立誓，從今已往不敢復犯。
translation: You must make your own vow, and from now on you won't dare to violate it again.

source_sentence: 并為我等先人父母夫婿兄弟，所有過罪，我今一心代其懺悔。
translation: Because of the sins committed by our forefathers, parents, husbands, sons, and brothers, I now repent with one mind for their sake.

source_sentence: 我弟子提違，以今懺悔、改惡修善福德因緣，施與一切受苦眾生，令其得樂。
translation: Because of my disciple Tiṣya's disobedience, he now repents and corrects bad causes and conditions for cultivating good virtues, bestows them on all suffering sentient beings, so that they attain happiness.

source_sentence: 眾生有罪，我當代受。
translation: Sentient beings have sins, and I'll accept them in my own time.

source_sentence: 復立誓言，緣我今日改邪就正、悔罪修福，從是因緣，捨身受身至成佛道，
translation: Again, he made this vow: By relying on me today to change what was wrong and turn right, to repent of sins and cultivate goodness. From this cause and condition, I will forsake body and receive body until I attain buddhahood.

source_sentence: 常遭明師、遇善知識，壽無量命，常與父母夫婿兒子六親眷屬常相保守，
translation: They always meet teachers of enlightenment and associate with spiritual benefactors. Their life spans are immeasurable, and they always keep their parents, husbands, sons, wife, sons, six children, and other members of their kinsmen together.

source_sentence: 不經苦患，莫如今也。』
translation: They won't experience suffering and distress, so don't do it now.'

source_sentence: 於是辯才告提違言：『悔過滅罪法皆如是。』
translation: He then spoke eloquently and contradicted Devadatta, saying, 'So it is with repentance and the method of extinguishing sins.'

source_sentence: 「於是提違及其眷屬，於辯才前長跪合掌，白辯才言：『弟子之徒奉尊教誨，
translation: 「於是提違及其眷屬,於辯才前長跪合掌,白辯才言, '弟子弟子弟子弟子弟子奉尊教誨,

source_sentence: 如法懺已，願尊更賜餘善法教，當勤奉行，增本功德。』
translation: After repenting according to the teaching, may the Bhagavān again bestow the teaching of the other good qualities, which should be diligently practiced and increase their original merit.'

source_sentence: 辯才告曰：『今當誠心歸佛、歸法、歸比丘僧，如是三說；
translation: The eloquent man said, “We should now sincerely turn our minds to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

source_sentence: 今當盡形受十善道。
translation: Now, he'll receive the ten good paths in full form.

source_sentence: 「我弟子某甲，從今盡形，不殺、不盜、不邪婬，是身善業；
translation: “Some of my disciples from now on will not kill, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. This is wholesome bodily action.

source_sentence: 不妄言、兩舌，不惡口、綺語，是口善業；
translation: Not lying, not divisive speech, and not engaging in harsh words or fancy flattery are verbal wholesome actions.

source_sentence: 不嫉妬、瞋恚、憍慢邪見，是意善業。」
translation: Not being jealous, angry, and arrogant with wrong views is good mental action.

source_sentence: 是則名為十善戒法。』
translation: This is called the ten good precepts.'

source_sentence: 「爾時辯才，教授提違十善法已，提違眷屬歡喜踊躍，盡心奉行。
translation: At that point, the eloquent man of eloquence taught Tiṣya the ten good qualities, and Tiṣya's followers rejoiced and jumped up and down in joy, wholeheartedly following them.

source_sentence: 提違女人為設種種百味飲食及諸珍寶，長跪叉手白辯才言：『願尊留神，
translation: In order to prepare various kinds of delicious food and other rare treasures, she knelt down with her palms joined together and said to the eloquent man, 'May the venerable retain his spirit.

source_sentence: 垂愍教化。
translation: It's a pity to teach and transform.

source_sentence: 今當為尊造立宮室，隨所便宜，終身奉事。』
translation: Now, I'll build a palace for the honored one and serve him for the rest of my life at any price.'

source_sentence: 辯才答曰：『汝今以能捨邪就正、淨修十善，為正法子；
translation: Vaibhavyūha replied: You have now abandoned evil and practiced the ten wholesome activities of righteousness and purity in order to become a true disciple of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 復以十善教化天下，則為已報師徒重恩。
translation: Again, if he teaches the world with the ten good qualities, then he'll repay the great kindness of his teacher and disciples who have already done so.

source_sentence: 汝已得度，我不宜留。
translation: Now that you have been liberated, I won't stay.

source_sentence: 吾今復當往化餘處。』
translation: Now, I will go to another place to transform myself.'

source_sentence: 「爾時提違知師不住，運輦庫藏諸珍寶物以奉上師，冀得留意。
translation: Knowing that the teacher wasn't staying, Tiṣya then carried the treasures in his storehouse and presented them to the superior teacher so he could pay attention.

source_sentence: 辯才不受，辭退便去。
translation: His eloquence was not accepted, and he withdrew and departed.

source_sentence: 於是提違心自念言：『今日之濟，莫不由我尊師和上開悟成就。
translation: Vairocana then thought to himself, 'Today's salvation doesn't come from the accomplishment of enlightenment by my venerable teacher and superior.

source_sentence: 教授重恩，苦請不留，又復不受珍寶之物，當如之何？』
translation: What should be done about the great kindness of the instruction that's so painfully requested and not allowed, and what should be done if you don't accept treasured things?'

source_sentence: 悲感傷心，涕淚交流，叩頭辭謝於是別去。
translation: With a feeling of sorrow and pity, he bowed his head in tears and departed.

source_sentence: 「辯才去後，提違女人與其眷屬五百餘人，常以十善法展轉相化，經於多時。
translation: “After Vaiśravaṇa’s departure, the woman Devānām-Indra and his five hundred members of his retinue always transformed each other through the ten wholesome practices for a long time.

source_sentence: 爾時國中，忽遇穀貴，人民飢餓。
translation: It was then that the country suddenly ran into a shortage of grain and its people were starving.

source_sentence: 時有五比丘懶惰懈怠，不修學問經書義理，又不專行持戒精進，世人輕慢不供養之，
translation: At that time five monks were lazy and indolent. They did not study the scriptures, inquired into their meanings and principles, and did not concentrate exclusively on keeping the precepts or exerting themselves energetically. The world despised them and did not support them.

source_sentence: 貧窮困苦無復生理。
translation: They're poor and distressed, and there's no longer a physical body.

source_sentence: 五人議曰：『夫人生計，隨時形宜，人命至重，何宜守死？』
translation: The five men agreed, saying, 'A man's life is calculated according to the time and place of birth, so why should he guard his body when his life is so serious?'

source_sentence: 各共乞索，辦具繩床於曠野中，掃灑淨潔、華幡莊嚴，依次而坐，外形似禪，
translation: Each of them begged for almsfood and prepared a rope bed in the wilderness, sweeping it clean and adorned it with flowers and banners. They sat down one after the other, their outer forms resembling meditation.

source_sentence: 內思邪濁。
translation: internal thoughts are wrong and turbid.

source_sentence: 世人見之謂是聖人，齎持供養百種飲食，雲集供養；
translation: People in the world regarded him as a sage, carrying offerings of one hundred kinds of food and drink with them and gathering clouds of offerings.

source_sentence: 三界聖尊、眾生之父，子今悔惡修善，甚是所欣，當隨喜爾。」
translation: The noble ones of the three realms and the fathers of sentient beings, whose sons now repent of evil and cultivate goodness, are so delighted that they'll rejoice.

source_sentence: 復有五百麁行比丘聞說是已，即起修敬，叩頭向佛白言：「世尊！
translation: After hearing these words, another five hundred monks in the assembly bowed their heads to the Buddha and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等不堪修出家道。
translation: We can't cultivate the renunciant path.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 從昔以來，為利養故行於邪濁、有虛無實，受人供養，負債滋多。
translation: Ever since the distant past, in order to gain profit and support, they've practiced what's wicked, false, and insubstantial, and they've received offerings from people who have a lot of debt.

source_sentence: 為是等故，實懷憂懼。
translation: Because of these things, they really harbor grief and fear.

source_sentence: 今欲捨道還歸俗緣，願佛垂聽。」
translation: Now, I want to abandon the path and return to secular conditions, so may the Buddha grant me permission to listen.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha told the monk, Good, good!

source_sentence: 吾助爾喜。
translation: I'll help you rejoice.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 夫人入行，如把刃持毒，不能堪者不如不為。
translation: When a woman enters and walks, she's like holding a sword with poison in her hand; those who can't get it won't do so.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 執持不勤，反為害故。
translation: Their attachment is not energetic, because they do harm in return.

source_sentence: 汝等今者，信於業報，有慚愧心；
translation: All of you now have faith in the results of your deeds and a sense of shame.

source_sentence: 慚愧因故，除滅過罪，增長善根。
translation: Because of the cause of shame and abashment, removal of transgressions is achieved and the roots of merit are increased.

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩後成佛時，初會說法當得上度。」
translation: When Maitreya Bodhisattva later becomes a buddha, he'll attain superior liberation when he first teaches the Dharma in the assembly.

source_sentence: 又告比丘：「寧割身肉以用供口，不以邪心受人施也。
translation: Again, he told the monk, I'd rather cut off my flesh to make offerings to my mouth than accept someone's gift with a wrong intention.

source_sentence: 甚難甚難！
translation: It's very difficult, very difficult!

source_sentence: 慎之慎之！」
translation: Be careful! Be careful!

source_sentence: 爾時佛子羅睺羅等五十沙彌，聞佛說彼扇提羅等禍所由起因緣本末，甚大憂懼，
translation: It was then that the fifty śrāmaṇeras, including the Buddha's son Rāhula, heard the Buddha tell them about the causes and conditions for the calamity caused by those calamities like Śandhāra. They were greatly grieved and frightened.

source_sentence: 即各修敬，頭面禮佛，叉手合掌白言：「世尊！
translation: Each of them then paid respect, bowed their heads and faces to the Buddha, saluted him with folded palms, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今聞說此扇提羅等宿業因緣受苦果報，甚懷怖懼。
translation: Now that I've heard this teaching about the causes and conditions of these past actions like Śāndhāra and others who experience painful results, I'm terrified and frightened.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 和上舍利弗大智福德，為國中豪族所見知識，眾人競共雲集供養，餉致最上甘珍美味。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa Śāriputra's great intelligence and virtue were known by the country's wealthy people, and crowds of people competed to gather clouds to make offerings, eating the most excellent delicious food.

source_sentence: 小兒愚癡無有福德，食人如是妙甘飲食，後世當復償其因緣，受苦果報如扇提羅，
translation: A small child is ignorant and lacks virtue. If someone eats such a delicious food or drink, they will be repaid in the afterlife for its causes and conditions and experience the results of suffering like Cāmaṇḍira.

source_sentence: 是故我等實懷憂慮。
translation: That's why we really harbor grief.

source_sentence: 彼諸長德五百比丘，尚不能堪，退道還俗，而況小兒無智慧者。
translation: Those five hundred monks of long virtue were still unable to do so, and they withdrew from the path and returned to secular life, much less those small children who lacked wisdom.

source_sentence: 願佛垂哀，賜聽我屬捨道還家，冀免罪酬、不經苦厄。」
translation: May the Buddha take pity on us and allow us to abandon the path and return home, hoping to be freed from our sins and rewards and not experience pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告羅睺羅：「汝今畏罪，欲得還家求離苦者，是事不然。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Rāhula, Now, you're afraid of sin and want to return home to seek freedom from suffering, but this is not the case.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 如有二人乏食飢餓，忽遇主人為設種種肥濃美味，其人飢餓，貪食過飽。
translation: Suppose there's a pair of hungry and hungry people who suddenly meet an owner and set up various rich foods for them, and they're hungry and craving food that's too full.

source_sentence: 然此二人，一者有智，二者愚癡。
translation: These two people, however, are first wise and second foolish.

source_sentence: 有智之人，自知食過，身體沈重嚬呻欠呿，恐致苦患，即詣明醫，謙虛下意叩頭求救，
translation: The wise man knew for himself that he had eaten too much, and his body was torpor-stricken, weeping heavily. Fearing that it would cause painful discomfort, he went to a physician skilled in the arts and medicines, humbly bowed his head in disrespect, and begged help.

source_sentence: 請除苦患。
translation: He asked to remove the suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 良醫即賜摩檀提藥，令其服之，其人即吐腹中宿食。
translation: The good doctor then gave him the medicine of sandalwood and told him to take it, and that man vomited up food in his belly for the night.

source_sentence: 吐宿食已，令近暖火，禁節消息。
translation: After he spits out his constellations and eats, he causes them to approach the warm fire and shuts off the news of the seasons.

source_sentence: 其人因是，得免禍患，終保年壽，安隱快樂。
translation: Because of this, that person will be able to avoid misfortune. At the end of life they will preserve their longevity and be peaceful and happy.

source_sentence: 其無智者不知食過，謂是鬼魅，消費家財、橫殺生命祠祭鬼神欲求濟命，
translation: Those lacking wisdom don't know what to eat, which is called a ghostly demon who spends his family's wealth and kills life indiscriminately as a sacrifice to the ghost spirits in order to save their lives.

source_sentence: 唐費功夫。
translation: The Tang spent effort.

source_sentence: 腹中宿食遂成生風，生氣轉筋絞切心痛，因是死亡生地獄中，累世受苦由無智焉。」
translation: When he eats in his belly, it creates a wind that grows and produces air, which turns his flesh into tendons and cuts his heart with pain; as a result, he dies and is born in hell, where he suffers for many lifetimes because of lack of knowledge.

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝羅睺羅！
translation: The Buddha said, You Rāhula!

source_sentence: 畏罪還家，如彼無智愚癡人也。
translation: They're afraid of sin and return home, just like those ignorant and foolish people.

source_sentence: 夫人求福欲離罪者，當謙虛精勤，親近明師，修習智慧，悔惡罪業，改往修來。
translation: A woman who seeks merit and wants to be free of sins should humbly exert effort, become intimate with a wise teacher, cultivate wisdom, repent of bad sinful actions, and change their past and future lives.

source_sentence: 從是漸漸智慧成就，慧成就故消滅眾罪。
translation: From this, gradual wisdom is accomplished, and because wisdom is accomplished, the sins are extinguished.

source_sentence: 如我前說日光威力能除眾冥，人修智慧亦復如是。
translation: As I've explained before, the power of sunlight can remove all darkness, and so is the wisdom cultivated by people likewise.

source_sentence: 緣汝先有善根因緣遭值我時，舍利弗等如彼明醫能濟苦患而得不死，子今何為捨明入暗？」
translation: When you had good causes and conditions before to meet me, Śāriputra and others like that bright doctor were able to save suffering and attain immortality, so why would you abandon light and enter darkness now?

source_sentence: 沙彌羅睺白言：「世尊！
translation: Śrāmaṇerapa said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸佛智慧猶如大海，羅睺等心猶如毫末，豈能受持如來智慧？」
translation: The wisdom of the buddhas is like the ocean, and the minds of Rāhu and so forth are like a tiny bit, so how can they receive and uphold the Tathāgata's wisdom?

source_sentence: 佛告羅睺：「如天雨渧，後不及前，雖不相及能滿大器。
translation: The Buddha told Rāhu, Suppose it's like a rainstorm in the sky that doesn't fall as late as the previous one, even though they don't match each other and can fill a large container.

source_sentence: 修學智慧亦復如是，從小微起終成大器，成大器已轉成餘器，如是展轉滿無量器，
是則名為自利利人，自利利人名為大士，如我今也。」
translation: This is called self-benefiting and benefiting people, and self-benefiting and benefiting people are called great men, just as I am now.

source_sentence: 羅睺羅等聞佛說已，心開意解無復憂慮，如世尊教，當具奉行，不敢疑也。
translation: Having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, Rāhula and others were enlightened. Their minds were freed from sorrow and they no longer had any worry about it. Just as the World-honored One instructed them, they should practice it in full; they did not dare to doubt it.

source_sentence: 爾時會中國王太子名曰祇陀，聞佛所說十善道法，因緣果報無有窮盡，
translation: It was then that the crown prince of the king of China, named Jeta, heard the Buddha teach the Dharma of the ten wholesome paths for endless causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 長跪叉手白天尊曰：「佛昔令我受持五戒，今欲還捨受十善法。
translation: Kneeling down, he saluted the Buddha and said to him, “In the past the Buddha instructed me to uphold the five precepts but now I want to renounce them and receive the ten kinds of virtuous practice.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 五戒法中，酒戒難持，畏得罪故。」
translation: Among the five precepts, the wine precept is difficult to uphold because it's fearful of committing crimes.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝飲酒時，為何惡耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, What's wrong with you drinking alcohol?

source_sentence: 祇陀白佛：「國中豪強時時相率齎持酒食，共相娛樂以致歡樂，自無惡也。
translation: Jeta said to the Buddha, At the time, the powerful people of the country often brought wine and food with them, and they amuse themselves together to make merry, without harming each other.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 得酒念戒，無放逸故，是故飲酒不行惡也。」
translation: Because he's mindful of the precept against drinking alcohol and not lax, he therefore drinks alcohol and doesn't do evil.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, Good, good!

source_sentence: 祇陀汝今已得智慧方便；
translation: Jeta, you have now attained the method of wisdom.

source_sentence: 若世間人能如汝者，終身飲酒有何惡哉？
translation: If people in the world can follow you, what evil would there be in drinking alcohol for the rest of your life?

source_sentence: 如是行者，乃應生福，無有罪也。
translation: Such a practitioner should then produce merit, and there's no offense.

source_sentence: 夫人行善凡有二種：一者有漏，二者無漏。
translation: There are two kinds of worldlings who practice goodness: those who are contaminated and those who are uncontaminated.

source_sentence: 有漏善者，常受人天快樂果報；
translation: The impure wholesome one always experiences the fruit of human and divine bliss.

source_sentence: 無漏善者，度生死苦涅槃果報。
translation: The pure wholesome one is the retribution of liberation from the suffering of transmigration in samsara and nirvana.

source_sentence: 若人飲酒，不起惡業歡喜心故，不起煩惱；
translation: If someone drinks alcohol and doesn’t give rise to evil deeds, because they rejoice with joy, no afflictions will arise.

source_sentence: 善心因緣，受善果報。
translation: Good awarenesses are the cause and condition for receiving the retribution of a good fruit.

source_sentence: 汝持五戒何有失乎？
translation: What's wrong with observing the five precepts?

source_sentence: 飲酒念戒，益增其福。
translation: Drinking alcohol and being mindful of the precepts increases their merit.

source_sentence: 先持五戒，今受十善，功德倍勝十善報也。」
translation: He previously observed the five precepts and now receives the ten good qualities, whose merit is twice as great as the rewards of the ten good qualities.

source_sentence: 時波斯匿王白言：「世尊！
translation: King Prasenajit then said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如佛所說，心歡喜時不起惡業，名有漏善者，是事不然。
translation: As the Buddha has said: “When awarenesses are joyous, bad action is not produced”: This is called ‘goodness impure’. This is not right.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 人飲酒時心則歡喜，歡喜心故不起煩惱，無煩惱故不行惱害，不害物故三業清淨，
translation: When a person drinks alcohol, his mind is joyous. Because he is joyous, no defilement arises; because he has no defilement, he does not harm others. Because he does not harm things, the three actions are purified:

source_sentence: 清淨之道即無漏業。
translation: The pure path is uncontaminated karma.

source_sentence: 世尊憶念，我昔遊行獵戲忘將厨宰，於深山中覺飢欲食，左右答言：『王朝去時，
translation: World-honored One, I remember one day, in the past, when I was engaged in hunting and playing but forgot to prepare a meal. Deep in the mountains I felt hungry and wished to eat.

source_sentence: 不被命勅令將厨宰，即時無食。』
translation: If someone isn't instructed to order the cook, there's no food at once.'

source_sentence: 我聞是語已，走馬還宮，教令索食。
translation: After hearing these words, I ran back to the palace and told him to ask for food.

source_sentence: 王家厨監名修迦羅。
translation: The kitchen superintendent of the king's household is called Śukala.

source_sentence: 修迦羅言：『即無現食，今方當作。』
translation: The sūtra says, 'That's when there's no present food, and now I'll do it.'

source_sentence: 我時飢逼，忿不思惟，瞋怒迷荒，教勅傍臣斬殺厨監。
translation: At the time, I was starving and overcome with anger and thoughtlessness, and my anger and wickedness led me into a wilderness of confusion.

source_sentence: 臣被王教即共議言：『簡括國中唯此一人忠良直事，今若殺者，更無有能為王監厨稱王意者。』
translation: The ministers were instructed by the king and agreed to discuss it together, saying, 'There's only this one person in the kingdom of Kauśinagara who's loyal and straightforward, but now if he kills them, there won't be anyone else who can serve as the king's superintendent of the kitchen and praise the king's intention.'

source_sentence: 時末利夫人，聞王教勅殺修迦羅，情甚愛惜；
translation: When Lady Māra heard the king’s command to kill Śubhavyūha, she cherished it.

source_sentence: 知王飢乏，即令辦具好肉美酒，沐浴名香、莊嚴身體，將諸伎女往至我所。
translation: Knowing that the king was hungry and thirsty, he ordered his court ladies to prepare delicious meat and wine, bathe in scented water, and adorn their bodies.

source_sentence: 我見夫人莊束嚴麗，將從妓女、好酒肉來，瞋心即歇。
translation: When I saw that the queen was beautifully adorned, coming from a prostitute and good wine and meat, my anger ceased.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 末利夫人持佛五戒，斷酒不飲，我心常恨。
translation: Lady Māra observed the Buddha’s five precepts, abstaining from alcoholic beverage consumption and from ingesting intoxicating liquor. My mind always hated her.

source_sentence: 今日忽然將酒肉來共相娛樂，展釋情故，即與夫人飲酒食肉，作眾伎樂歡喜娛樂，
translation: Suddenly on that day he brought wine and meat to enjoy themselves together. Because of his love for the goddess, he gave her to drink wine and eat meat, and delighted in performing various kinds of music and feasting.

source_sentence: 恚心即滅。
translation: The debilitating mind ceases.

source_sentence: 夫人知我忘失怒意，即遣黃門輒傳我命，令語外臣莫殺厨監。
translation: Knowing that I'd forgotten my anger, the lady sent a letter to the yellow door and told me to tell the foreign ministers not to kill the kitchen manager.

source_sentence: 即奉教旨。
translation: That's the purpose of following the teaching.

source_sentence: 我至明旦深自悔責，愁憂不樂顏色憔悴。
translation: On the morning of the following day I deeply repented and felt distressed. Sad and unhappy, my countenance was emaciated.

source_sentence: 夫人問我：『何故憂愁，為何患耶？』
translation: The lady asked me, 'Why are you so sad and what's the trouble?'

source_sentence: 我言：『吾因昨日為飢火所逼，瞋恚心故殺修迦羅。
translation: I said, 'I was driven by the fire of hunger yesterday and killed Śubha because of my anger.

source_sentence: 自計國中更無有人堪監我厨如修迦羅者，為是之故悔恨愁耳。』
translation: There's no one in my own country who can supervise my kitchen like Śubhavyūha, and because of this, I repent and grieve.'

source_sentence: 夫人笑曰：『其人猶在，願王莫愁。』
translation: The lady laughed and said, 'That man is still here, so may the king not be sad.'

source_sentence: 我重問曰：『為實如是，為戲言耶？』
translation: I repeatedly asked, 'Is it really like this or is it just a playful statement?'

source_sentence: 答言：『實在，非虛言也。』
translation: He replied, 'It's true, not false speech.'

source_sentence: 我令左右喚厨監來，使者往召須臾將來，我大歡喜，憂恨即除。」
translation: I'll cause my left and right to call the kitchen superintendent to come, and he'll summon me in a moment or so, and I'll be greatly delighted, remorseless.

source_sentence: 王白佛言：「末利夫人持佛五戒、月行六齋，一日之中，終身五戒以犯飲酒、妄語二戒，
translation: The king said to the Buddha, “The queen of Māra observed the five precepts for one day and a fortnight, observing the six days of purification. For the rest of her life she upheld the five precepts by drinking intoxicating liquor and speaking falsely.

source_sentence: 八齋戒中頓犯六戒。
translation: In the eight precepts of purification, he suddenly violates the six precepts.

source_sentence: 此事云何？
translation: What is this matter?

source_sentence: 所犯戒罪，輕耶重耶？」
translation: Is the sin of violating the precepts, is it light or heavy?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「如此犯戒，得大功德，無有罪也。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, There's no offense for someone who violates the precepts like this to attain great merit.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 為利益故。
translation: It's for the sake of benefit.

source_sentence: 如我前說，夫人修善凡有二種：一有漏善，二無漏善。
translation: As I said before, there are two kinds of people who cultivate goodness: those who are contaminated and those who are uncontaminated.

source_sentence: 末利夫人所犯戒者，入有漏善；
translation: The precept violated by Lady Māra is to enter the pure and impure good.

source_sentence: 不犯戒者，名無漏善。
translation: Those who don't violate the precepts are called uncontaminated good.

source_sentence: 依語義者，破戒修善，名有漏善；
translation: Relying on words and meanings, breaking the precepts and cultivating wholesomeness is called ‘contaminated wholesomeness’.

source_sentence: 依義語者，凡心所起善，皆無漏業。」
translation: Those who rely on meaningful words, the goodness that arises in ordinary minds are all uncontaminated actions.

source_sentence: 王白佛言：「如世尊說，末利夫人飲酒破戒，不起惡心，而有功德、無罪報者，
translation: The king said to the Buddha: Just as the World-honored One said, “Mrs. Māra’s wife drinking alcohol breaks the precepts and does not give rise to thoughts of anger.

source_sentence: 一切人民亦復皆然。
translation: So it is with all the people.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我念近昔舍衛城中，有諸豪族剎利王公因小諍競乃致大怨，各各結謀興兵相罰，
translation: I remember one day, in the city of Śrāvastī, there were various powerful war lords and kings of the kṣatriya clansmen who had caused a dispute among themselves to provoke a great enmity. Each of them plotted against the other and drew up an army to punish him.

source_sentence: 兩家並是國中豪種，復是親戚，非可執錄，紛紜鬪戰不從理諫，深為憂之。
translation: The two families were all powerful clans of the country and were also relatives, so they could not be recorded in books. They were involved in disputes and quarrels and did not admonish each other according to reason.

source_sentence: 復自念言：『昔太子時，先王大臣名提違羅，恃其門宗富貴豪強，而見輕慢、形調戲弄，
translation: Again he thought to himself, “Formerly the prince had formerly been a minister of the king named Tiṣyapradīpa. Relying on the wealthy and powerful clanspeople of his school, he despised their arrogance, disrespected their physical appearance, and played happily.

source_sentence: 劇於畜生。
translation: It's a disaster for animals.

source_sentence: 當時忿恚，情實不分，意欲誅滅，力所不堪；
translation: At that time the enemy was furious and unable to distinguish their emotions. Their thoughts of wanting to be slain were so strong that they could not bear them.

source_sentence: 訴向父王，復不聽省。
translation: He appealed to his father, the king, who would not allow him to examine it.

source_sentence: 懷毒抱恨，非可如何。
translation: To harbor anger and hate is not what can be done.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，飲食損常，懊惱愁悴。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, food and drink were lost to the common people and they felt disheartened and distressed.

source_sentence: 爾時太后見我愁苦，種種諫曉，愁故不息。
translation: At the time, the Empress Dowager saw my grief and variously remonstrated with me, but she didn't stop being sad.
